channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The glass left from yahrzeit candles can be another way to memorialize a loved one
item.description: In Jewish tradition, after someone dies, the anniversary of their death is marked by lighting a yahrzeit candle. It comes in a stubby glass holder. In some families, that old glass found a new use.
item.content:encoded: In Jewish tradition, after someone dies, the anniversary of their death is marked by lighting a yahrzeit candle. It comes in a stubby glass holder. In some families, that old glass found a new use.
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: Many Seahawks fans were hoping for a rematch with the Patriots for years
item.description: The Seattle Seahawks won their second Super Bowl with a convincing victory over the New England Patriots. People in Seattle started the celebrations even before the game was over.
item.content:encoded: The Seattle Seahawks won their second Super Bowl with a convincing victory over the New England Patriots. People in Seattle started the celebrations even before the game was over.
item.dc:creator: Kate Stone

item.title: Modest 'mental exercise' can reduce risk of dementia for decades, study finds
item.description: One type of cognitive training appears to reduce the risk of dementia 20 years later.
item.content:encoded: One type of cognitive training appears to reduce the risk of dementia 20 years later.
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: AI complicates proof of life in the search for Savannah Guthrie's mother
item.description: The FBI says AI is complicating the idea of a proof of life message in the search for Savannah Guthrie's mom. Experts say AI needs just a few short clips of a person to render a convincing fake.
item.content:encoded: The FBI says AI is complicating the idea of a proof of life message in the search for Savannah Guthrie's mom. Experts say AI needs just a few short clips of a person to render a convincing fake.
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: In Lebanon, a college campus welcomes cats abandoned in war
item.description: At the American University of Beirut where up to 1,600 rescued cats roam the campus.
item.content:encoded: At the American University of Beirut where up to 1,600 rescued cats roam the campus.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Palestinian Authority tries to reform, but one measure is sparking a backlash
item.description: Under pressure to reform, the Palestinian Authority is ending its payments to families whose relatives are killed or jailed by Israel.
item.content:encoded: Under pressure to reform, the Palestinian Authority is ending its payments to families whose relatives are killed or jailed by Israel.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: In Oregon, a dog competition tries to get more dogs into truffle hunting
item.description: Organizers of a truffle dog championship for amateurs in Oregon hope it will draw more people to truffle hunting with dogs, which some experts say could improve the Pacific Northwest's truffle crop.
item.content:encoded: Organizers of a truffle dog championship for amateurs in Oregon hope it will draw more people to truffle hunting with dogs, which some experts say could improve the Pacific Northwest's truffle crop.
item.dc:creator: Crystal Ligori

item.title: This really is U.S. biathlon's year
item.description: Biathlon is the only winter Olympic sport in which the U.S. has never medaled. But this year, the U.S. has the two standout biathletes and a coach who grew up on the doorstep of the Olympic venue.
item.content:encoded: Biathlon is the only winter Olympic sport in which the U.S. has never medaled. But this year, the U.S. has the two standout biathletes and a coach who grew up on the doorstep of the Olympic venue.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Watching Bad Bunny's Super Bowl show in Puerto Rico
item.description: In San Juan, Puerto Rico, we watched the Super Bowl halftime show with the audience Bad Bunny has represented since his start: his fellow Puerto Ricans.
item.content:encoded: In San Juan, Puerto Rico, we watched the Super Bowl halftime show with the audience Bad Bunny has represented since his start: his fellow Puerto Ricans.
item.dc:creator: Isabella Gomez Sarmiento

item.title: How the latest Epstein revelations are playing out in the U.K.
item.description: King Charles' brother lost his titles, the U.K. ambassador to the U.S. resigned, and there are calls for the prime minister to resign. Why does the Epstein fallout seem to be greater in the U.K.?
item.content:encoded: King Charles' brother lost his titles, the U.K. ambassador to the U.S. resigned, and there are calls for the prime minister to resign. Why does the Epstein fallout seem to be greater in the U.K.?
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith
